summary: This bill, the Medic Education and Deployment Into Civilian Careers Act of 2025 (MEDIC Careers Act), aims to improve the transition of military medics into civilian healthcare occupations. It mandates the Secretary of Defense and Secretary of Homeland Security to develop recommendations for streamlining this transition, addressing barriers such as credentialing, training programs, and information dissemination. The bill also establishes a pilot program providing grants to healthcare providers to support the hiring, training, and retention of separating Armed Forces members. The pilot program aims to improve access to and quality of civilian healthcare by these veterans.
